Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2008 12:05PM goldengirl wrote: Original breast cancer 1994.  Mets diagnosed January 2006, lung and ribs.  Still stable with only Femara and Zometa. 2 years and hoping for many, many more!!!
Posts.Title: Stage 3 or 4. How many still here 5 yrs later? tooyoungtohavebc SpunkyGirl

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2010 07:42PM goldengirl wrote: Thanks everyone.  I spoke with the Onc today and he thinks I should try the Estradiol 6mg for awhile and then eventually switch back to hormonals.  He scared me a little with the side effects though - so now I'm not sure what to do.  Going to start a new post to see if anyone else has tried this treatment plan.  I'm not up for being nauseaous and vomiting all day or losing more hair (Femara has already thinned it enough).  He said the Faslodex has less side effects but really feels I would be a good candidate for the Estradiol.  Hope he's not using me as a test subject : )
Posts.Title: Tumor Markers goldengirl goldengirl

Posts.Content: goldengirl wrote: My tumor markers have jumped from 27 up to 58 in the last 3 months.  Does this always indicate progression?  I had a PET/CT today - so now it's the waiting game. Ugh!  I've been on Femara for 4years with great success - maybe my time on this has run out.  Debbie Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tumor Markers goldengirl goldengirl

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2010 09:41AM goldengirl wrote: So I saw my Onc yesterday and he only had the draft report of the PET/CT and it showed the tumor in the left lung is larger, more activity in the ribs and the one on the diaphragm is "fuller" (whatever that means) and 2 new spots on my spine at T12, L1.  So I'm off the Femara, thankful for the 4 years it gave me, and on to something new.  Since I repsonded so well to the Femara he is thinking of Faslodex or putting me on high doses of estrogen and then back on anti-hormonals.  He is reviewing this with the other oncs in the practice to see what they think is the best route.  So here we go. Can't say I was thrilled with this report, but its not as bad as others on here...I really hate this disease and why the he** can't they find a cure already!!! Debbie
Posts.Title: Tumor Markers goldengirl goldengirl

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2010 01:01AM goldengirl wrote: I am so sorry for all that you are going through!  Saying prayers.  You will dig deep and find the strength to deal with all of this.  Enjoy each day that you are feeling good and (easy for me to say) try not to dwell on the sadness but find happiness in the small things.  Big hug : )
